The lunar rover had a camera that was remote controlled from mission control. There are three videos of lunar takeoff but only Apollo 17 timed it right. The operator on the ground had to manually send the signal to pan up 1.28 seconds BEFORE they took off and had to wait another 1.28 seconds to see the image. It's amazing he kept it in frame as long as he did (over 30 seconds). You can even see the flame of the engine after they pitch over.
